page.title: 05TOWN CENTRE SHOPS.
page.content: HOCKLEY IS A SMALL TOWN WITH LIMITED SHOPPING FACILITIES, SIMILAR TO A DISTRICT CENTRE WITHIN A MAJOR TOWN. THE TYPE OF SHOPPING FACILITIES ARE LIMITED TO MEDIUM ORDER SHOPS AND OFFICE FACILITIES. THIS IS DUE TO THE TOWNS PROXIMITY TO SOUTHEND AND BASILDON WHICH PROVIDE THE REGIONS MAIN SHOPPING CENTRES. THE TYPE OF SHOPS FOUND WITHIN THE CENTRE HAVE AN OBVIOUS INFLUENCE UPON THE MARKET AREA. PEOPLE WHO USE THE CENTRE COME FROM THE TOWN AND SMALL VILLAGES TO THE NORTH. THIS IS ONLY FOR GENERAL SHOPPING AND NOT FOR CLOTHING AND FURNITURE AS THESE FACILITIES ARE LIMITED. WHEN PEOPLE SHOP FOR HIGH ORDER GOODS THEY REQUIRE A SHOPPING CENTRE WITH A WIDE SELECTION AND THEREFORE TRAVEL TO LARGER TOWNS AND SHOPPING CENTRES.
